summary: Lets you craft placeable Trophies using the Campfire system.
descriptionHtml:
[Heading][size=3][b]Craftable Trophies - Campfire Addon[/b][/size][/Heading]

This is a mod that I made per request by [url=https://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/user/3649781-jskull1986/]JSkull1986[/url]. It is a simple mod that allows you to place pedestals with trophies in the worldspace, thanks to the usage of Campfire system. 

[Heading][size=3]Pedestals:[/size][/Heading]
Before you create trophies, you need to create pedestals. The two from HF can be build, as well as five new, including two that can hold not one, but two trophies. You create them from quarry rock, clay, firewood and others in the Campfire Create item Menu.

Then, you click "Manage Trophy", which will let you either create, or place trophy if you had one already.

[Heading][size=3]Storing & scaling trophies[/size][/Heading]

Some of the trophies are too small/large for their pedestals. That's why I included an option to scale it!

Much like in Fallout 4, the trophies that you build and then take away are stored in a safe container, allowing you to move the trophies from one pedestal to another. Each pedestal remembers also the scale of every trophy you placed on it, so you don't have to worry about doing it again (at least not until you put it away). [b]If you want to pick up a pedestal, you have to first remove a trophy on it (however, from version 1.01 I found a workaround which should work)[/b]; I wanted to consolidate these two menus, but unfortunately it is not possible with current Campire Devkit, I informed Chesko about it. Sorry for inconvenience.

Some of the pedestals start with 50% scale already - the Stone Small one and the Stone Double.

[Heading][size=3]List of trophies[/size][/Heading]
[list]
[*][size=2]Original 27 trophies from the[url=http://en.uesp.net/wiki/Skyrim:Trophy_Room] Hf Trophy room[/url]; the only difference is that Sawn logs are replaced by Firewood,[/size]
[*][size=2]Riekling,[/size]
[*][size=2]Armored Troll,[/size]
[*][size=2]DeathHound,[/size]
[*][size=2]Gargoyle (two variants)[/size]
[*][size=2]Vampire Lord[/size]
[*][size=2]Dwarven Steam Centurion[/size]
[*][size=2]DRAGONS, WHY ON NIRN WEREN'T WE ABLE TO CRAFT DRAGON TROPHIES IN A GAME THAT CENTERS AROUND KILLING THEM[/size]
[*][size=2]Lurker[/size]
[*][size=2]Seeker[/size]
[*][size=2]Netch[/size]
[*][size=2]Ash Spawn[/size]
[*][size=2]Dwarven Ballista[/size]
[/list]
Some of the trophies require finishing certain quests. So you won't be able to build a Vampire Lord Trophy before defeating Harkon, and Lurkers until you cleanse all the stones on Solstheim. This option can be turned off in the MCM.


[Heading][size=3]Information & Troubleshooting [/size][/Heading]

This mod, quite obviously [b]requires[/b] Chesko's [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/64798/?]Campfire[/url] 1.8+

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/64798][img]http://i.imgur.com/kPyl4AD.png[/img][/url]


Warning: I'm not the best person to deal with 3d models and the Havok physics, so if you drop a miscellaneous item it might not behave like you expected, breaking several known laws of physics. Similarly, placing some items in the world may be tricky, though it is an inherent problem with all such mods. The same can be said about the triggerboxes - they can sometimes be difficult to click.

This mod should be compatible with any mod out there, since it doesn't touch the original HF scripts.

Also, if you'd like to cheat a bit or test the mod you can open console (~) and type[font=Courier New]

      setstage _camp_trophies_quest 100

[/font]That will open a cheatchest with lots of elements to test on.

Just like with my previous mods, if you find any problem, please add it to the bugs section.

[Heading][size=3]Translations [/size][/Heading]
The mod has been localised in TesVedit, translated in [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/29148/?]TesVTranslator[/url]; all of the Strings files are included in the archive. MCM is translatable as well.
Currently supported languages: [b]English[/b], [b]Polish[/b], and [b]Japanese (1.02 onward, thanks to BowmoreLover. Thanks!)[/b]. Other languages use English as base. If you are expecting CTDs because of my mod and you are not playing any of the translated languages, contact me. If you would like to translate the mod, contact me, so I can credit you and include your strings in my mod!
